homepage.purpose: We connect SEG & EECS students with industry professionals in software engineering, providing resources, networking, and career development.
homepage.events_subheading: Register today and save the date. Add our events to your calendar using the built-in embed feature!
homepage.resources_subheading: Our academic team actively organize free resources to support software engineering students in their studies.
homepage.coming_soon_subtitle: All the resources you need, in one place—launching soon.
homepage.sponsors_heading_h1: by the best in the game
homepage.sponsors_subheading: We're incredibly grateful to our partners who believe in our mission to connect students with industry professionals.
homepage.faq_description: We have A's to your Q's below. If you still have questions, contact us and we'll get back to you as soon as possible.

faq_q1.title: WHAT IS SESA?
faq_q1.answer:
SESA is the University of Ottawa **Software Engineering Students Association**! We're an informally and independently run student organization with the mission of enriching SEG student life, promoting software engineering as a field, and supporting students academically and professionally as they begin their careers.

Our initiatives are designed to help students succeed both in and out of the classroom. These include:

- **Professional development workshops** and networking events for students
- **Academic support** through study resources
- **Social and community-building events** to bring students together
- **Student outreach** to inspire and engage future engineers
- **Advocacy** for the SEG student voice within uOttawa

faq_q2.title: WHO CAN JOIN?
faq_q2.answer:
**SESA events are open to everyone** — not just software engineering students!

Whether you're a high school student, community member, undergraduate, graduate, or alum, you're welcome to attend (unless stated otherwise).

**To become a SESA team member:**
- **You must be an enrolled uOttawa student** (undergraduate or graduate, full-time or part-time)
- You don't have to be in the **software engineering program** — just passionate about the community

faq_q3.title: WHAT MAKES SESA SPECIAL?
faq_q3.answer:
**SESA is run by students, for students**, with a focus on community, collaboration, and creating opportunities.

We're committed to building an **inclusive space** where anyone can get involved, learn, and grow.

faq_q4.title: WHAT EVENTS DOES SESA HOST?
faq_q4.answer:
SESA hosts tech-related events each year at the University of Ottawa, including technical workshops, career fairs, meet and greets, mock interviews, and product launches.

Many of these activities are in partnership with community organizations, such as [Sponsor page](/en/sponsors) to help organize high quality experiences comparable to the professional workplace.

homepage.faq_response_time: We'll get back to you within 48 hours.

about.inspiring_blurb: We're a student organization dedicated to enriching SEG student life, promoting software engineering, and supporting academic and professional development.
about.who_are_we_heading: We're a student-led organization made up of
about.who_are_we_p1: the Software Engineering Student Association (SESA) helps students gain practical, hands-on experience, and make connections while still in university.
about.who_are_we_p2_bold: Partnered with the Faculity of Engineering, we address challenges
about.who_are_we_p2: in academic support, professional development, and engagement with the software engineering industry.
about.what_do_we_do_p: of software engineers for the workplace by offering exciting experiences and opportunities in partnership with industry professionals.

what_do_we_do_cards.social_events_desc: We organize educational events and entertaining events, such as movie nights, dog therapy, game nights, and parties.
what_do_we_do_cards.academic_support_desc: We also provide academic help, including mentorship, resources, advice, and support on coursework, projects, and exams.
what_do_we_do_cards.professional_development_desc: Additionally, we provide career development opportunities, including workshops, speaker series, and networking events.

about.introducing_our_team_blurb: Meet the incredible back-end team that drives our front-end success and makes everything possible.

introducing_our_team_section.codirectors_desc: Meet our Co-Directors, who keep everything running smoothly. They oversee projects, support the team, and make sure goals are met with a clear vision and strong collaboration.
introducing_our_team_section.partnerships_desc: Relationship builders, collaborating with sponsors, partners, and stakeholders to drive mutual growth and opportunities.
introducing_our_team_section.events_desc: The organizers and planners, bringing our community together through impactful workshops, seminars, and conferences.
introducing_our_team_section.communications_desc: Creative minds driving social media, website design, and digital outreach with style and impact.
introducing_our_team_section.development_desc: The tech powerhouse behind our projects, building innovative solutions and maintaining our website.
introducing_our_team_section.academic_desc: Experts in research and knowledge sharing, supporting educational initiatives and ensuring the quality of academic outputs.
introducing_our_team_section.advisors_desc: Our trusted mentors provide guidance and insights to help the team navigate challenges and achieve success.

about.our_previous_partners_p_bold: Our community of past executive members spans around the globe
about.our_previous_partners_p: making their mark in top industries. Here are just a few places where you'll find the impact of our talented network driving innovation and success.
about.our_family: Be a part of our family
about.our_family_p: Build, learn, and connect with like-minded peers while helping shape the next generation of software engineers.
about.no_more_apps: We're no longer accepting applications for Fall 2025. Stay tuned for Winter 2026 openings!

sponsorships.past_collaborators_description: We've had the privilege of working with over 20+ big and small companies that have enhanced our events, including:
sponsorships.benefits_description: Without our sponsors and partners, we would not be able to fund our events and projects that provide SEG students with academic opportunities and workplace experiences.

terms.tnc: We are committed to academic integrity. The resources and assistance we provide are intended for educational purposes only. We do not support or condone academic dishonesty, including but not limited to plagiarism, cheating, or any other violation of academic or institutional policies. By using our services, you agree to use the information and help you receive responsibly and in accordance with all applicable rules and regulations.
terms.privacy: Your privacy is important to us. When you use our contact form, we collect the personal information you voluntarily provide, such as your name, email address, and the content of your message. This information is used exclusively to respond to your inquiries and to communicate with you about our club's activities and resources. We do not sell, share, or disclose your information to any third parties.

footer.blurb: We connect SEG & EECS students with software engineering industry professionals, providing resources and support.
